data.title: Raslene – Mekong Cultural Hub
data.meta_description: Bringing to life visions for a sustainable and inclusive Mekong region
data.text:
(Raslene)

City:Jakarta

LAI Alumni:SEAD Fellow

MCH Networks:Meeting Point 2022

Affiliations:Synchronizing Asian Contemporary Moving Image Art

Bio: Raslene is a part-time video and visual artist based in Jakarta. She joined her first group exhibition in Jakarta 32ºC 2012, a visual exhibition and networking forum for college students. After graduating from School of Design, she gradually restarted her artistic activities in 2015. Her works were featured in several media arts festivals which were also presented in Gwangju and Berlin. Her practice deals with found footage and archives, re-questioning and engaging the historical and contemporary moving image-making, individually or through a collaboration. She also works on research: Social, cultural, political or sustainability concerns such as lost archives issues attract her interest. In 2019, she and her friends initiated a writing blog, Synchronizing Asian Contemporary Moving Image Art. Currently, she’s exploring cultural leadership and management in order to grow a sustainable working culture in her environment.

Information on this page is provided by the person whose name is on each profile. MCH holds no copyright nor authority to the content. When you use the contact information on this page to reach out to the person, we appreciate it if you let them know where you found their profile.
